title: Please ID this script and serif font if you can
content:
I'm curious on the two fonts used in this image. Please help if you can.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220045510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fonts_3777.jpg)
author: fasoltmn

comments.content: That script font is sweet! Sorry, I couldn't find out what is this.
it's similar to Kushtie, but that's not it.
it's similar to Kushtie, but that's not it.

The script reminds me of [Memimas](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220045510/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/fonts.php?id=36) from Type-O-Tones, but it's not the same. I searched all of MyFonts and Veer for informal scripts and couldn't find it either.

How do they make fonts look like letterpress? Are they making plates from the fonts?

- Mike Yanega
I'm assuming this is letterpress printed from photopolymer plates (which can be made from digital data).

Thanks Nina. I learn something every day here.

- Mike Yanega
You're welcome Mike. I actually learned that from Typophile too. :-)
